text: This is a list with brief descriptions of Topps sports card products for 1974. ==Baseball== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |660 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Red Team Checklists | |24 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Traded | |44 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ===Parallel Sets=== Since 1965, the Canadian candy company O-Pee-Chee produced virtually identical, but smaller, sets identical to the Topps issue of the same year. The Canadian printed cards were printed on grey cardstock and featured French and English text on the reverse. The 1974 set featured yellow backs rather than green used by Topps. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |O-Pee-Chee | |660 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Red Team Checklists | |24 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |} ==Football== In 1974, Topps issued three Football sets featuring the National Football League. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |528 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Parker Brothers Pro Draft | |50 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Team Checklists | |26 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==Hockey== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |264 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==Basketball== Topps issued one set featuring the two professional basketball leagues, the National Basketball Association and the American Basketball Association, playing during the 1974-1975 season. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |264 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==References== * Beckett, Dr. James et al. (2002). "Beckett Baseball Card Price Guide". Beckett Publications-Dallas, Texas Category:Chewing gum Category:Baseball cards Category:Trading cards Category:Topps
title: 1974 Topps
